text:
Do pro-gun types who argue against gun laws because "legislation will never change the hearts of man" [as an emailer just put it] apply that rationale to any other subject on earth?
"Let's not prohibit murder, assault, burglary. Can't go changing the hearts of men, after all!"

After police killed a young black man holding a gun that wasn't loaded, a West Virginia police department fired one of its officers. 

They fired the officer who didn't shoot--the one who paused. 

And he was labeled a coward.
